pullRequest.title: RemoveResourceWrapperAndJsonSerializableWrapper
pullRequest.bodyText:
Resolves several comments from the previous JsonSerializableUpdate PR:
#10895

Remove JsonSerializableWrapper
Remove ResourceWrapper
CosmosError: remove extending from Resource
Rename setAnalyticalStoreTimeToLiveInSeconds inside DocumentCollection, so to be consistent with
CosmosContainerProperties
Remove ValidateResource from CosmosAsyncContainer

nodes.bodyText:
You should be able to do class equality here as none of the classes is expected to be subclassed.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    return CompositePath.class.isAssignableFrom(c)
          
          
            
            CompositePath.class.equals(c)

code style: open braces on the same line as method definition

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                void populatePropertyBag()
          
          
            
             void populatePropertyBag() {
I would just call it getJsonSerializable(T t)

doesn't this result in double json serialization/deserialization?
can we pass ObjectNode instead? otherwise this will serialize to string and the corresponding class will deserialize string back to ObjectNode.
getId is a required method in the Properties classes that we removed.
once getId() is added back we should undo this change as getId will be required method in CosmosDatabaseProperties.

once getId() is added back we should undo this change as getId will be required method in CosmosDatabaseProperties.
here and in other places for the properties classes.

getId is a required method in the Properties classes that we removed.
please add back here and other places.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@
  * more cosmos items. Since databases are an an administrative resource and the Service Key will be required in
  * order to access and successfully complete any action using the User APIs.
  */
-public final class CosmosDatabaseProperties extends ResourceWrapper{

commit.message: add getId, getResourceId, getTimestamp, getEtag for properties

nodes.bodyText:
one thing we should discuss is the return type. The timestamp is in UTC and so it doesn't have a zone offset. I wonder if Instant is a better choice here.
This is outside of scope of this PR.
/cc @kushagraThapar something we should track.
can t be null here? if it can this method will throw IllegalArgumentException. is it expected for null?
